LONDON( AFP)- British Prime Minister David Cameron began looking for a new media chief Saturday to replace Andy Coulson after he quit over a tabloid phone-hacking row, in a test for the nine-month-old government. So far, our worst day in government, a senior David Cameron aide told The Guardian after Andy Coulson quit Friday, bowing to pressure over what he knew about hacking at the News of the World( NOTW) when he was its editor. current workers are located. In a speech Tuesday, Eric Schmidt said Google Inc. will hire more than 1,000 workers in Europe this year. All told, Google Inc. has more than 60 offices in 30 countries. At this stage, the number of opportunities just vastly exceed the number of people we have at the company, said Alan Eustace , Google Inc. 's senior vice president of engineering and research. Even if it surpasses 31,000 employees this year, Google Inc. will still have far fewer people than Microsoft Corp., among its fiercest rival.

Page praised Eric Schmidt , too.`` There is no other CEO in the world that could have kept such headstrong founders so deeply involved and still run the business so brilliantly,'' Page said. Eric Schmidt is a tremendous leader and I have learned innumerable lessons from him. The change in command overshadowed Google Inc. 's fourth-quarter earnings, which soared past analysts' estimates as the company cranked up its Internet marketing machine during the holiday shopping season.

Hopefully, they change it. He's a quarterback, too. He's the same as everybody else. Just because he's maybe a little bit more athletic and faster and can run, he shouldn't be penalized.
